settings.specialized__what_content: Exercising regularly has many health benefits. It can combat and alleviate some health conditions, and improve mood, energy, and sleep, among many other things. However excessive exercise can wreak havoc on the body, especially when paired with a lack of nutrition.If an excessive exercise regimen is maintained for an extended period of time, it may put your body into a state of chronic stress which can lead to injuries, a feeling of muscle soreness and weakness, hair loss, and many more symptoms.  Hair loss caused by stress, whether it be chronic or caused by a traumatic event, is known as Telogen Effluvium.

settings.heading: What symptoms are experienced with an excessive exercise regimen?
settings.specialized__faqs_ans:
• Feeling tired or lethargic
  • Feeling depressed
  • Needing longer periods of rest and recovery
  • Feeling irritable or anxious
  • Having difficulty sleeping 
  • Muscle soreness 
  • Increased exercise-related injury
  • Contracting colds frequently

settings.heading: How to treat symptoms caused by over-exercising:
settings.specialized__faqs_ans:
If you have over-extended yourself and are experiencing negative symptoms from your exercise routine, you may need to take a break from it. Typically most symptoms will resolve themselves within 2-4 weeks.

Hair loss experienced due to over-training may take a few months longer to resolve. Telogen Effluvium (hair loss induced by stress) may take closer to 3-6 months to resume hair growth. If you have experienced hair loss due to over-training you may need to adjust your routine and visit your doctor as they may want to test you for vitamin deficiencies that could be contributing to your hair loss.

settings.heading: Anorexia Nervosa and Anorexia Athletica
settings.specialized__faqs_ans:
Over-exercising can also be a symptom of an eating disorder such as Anorexia Nervosa or Anorexia Athletica. 

Anorexia Nervosa is an eating disorder that results in a person becoming obsessive and highly restrictive over their weight and diet. This kind of anorexia can lead to severe weight loss as typically this type of anorexia is often motivated by of weight gain. People with Anorexia Nervosa typically eat a very low caloric diet and sometimes will also exercise excessively. Some symptoms of Anorexia Nervosa include:

  • Fatigue and exhaustion
  • Insomnia
  • Dry skin
  • Irregular menstrual cycles
  • Thinning hair
  • Low blood pressure

Behaviors what may be noticed in relation to Anorexia Nervosa include:

  • Excessive exercise
  • Playing with food, or pushing it around plate rather than eating it
  • Use of diuretics and laxatives
  • Refusal to eat when hungry, or denial of hunger

Long term risks of Anorexia Nervosa:

  • Hypotension
  • Heart arrhythmia, bradycardia, and weakened heart
  • Heart Attack
  • Poor Circulation
  • Nerve Damage
  • Seizures
  • Osteoporosis and brittle bones
  • Infertility or issues with fertility
  • Miscarriage
  • Numbness and/or pain in hands and feet

Anorexia Nervosa is treatable. If you feel you may be suffering from Anorexia Nervosa, please visit your doctor. There are health care professionals, therapists, and programs that can help you reach a more balanced approach to health and diet.

Anorexia Athletica (also known as Exercise Bulimia and Hyper Gymnasia) is an eating disorder in which people manage their caloric intake, and often their weight, by overexercising which is sometimes also combined with a very restrictive diet. This disorder is most commonly experienced by athletes as this kind of anorexia is most commonly motivated by performance rather than weight loss. Here are some common signs and symptoms experienced with anorexia athletica:

  • An overall feeling of depression, irritability, or anxiety when a workout is missed 
  • Feeling that you must workout daily 
  • Exercising when ill or injured 
  • Relationships, responsibilities, or work suffer as the consequence of a restrictive workout schedule
  • Determining the amount of exercise needed to burn calories based on diet

Long term risks of Anorexia Athletica: 

  • Irregular or absent menstrual cycle Organ failure of the liver heart, and brain
  • Muscle fatigue
  • Exercise-related injury
  • Heart attack

Anorexia athletica can be managed. If you feel that you may have anorexia athletica then you first will want to speak to your doctor or a healthcare professional. There are doctors, nutritionists, and other health care professionals as well as programs that can help you achieve a more balanced approach to diet and exercise.

settings.heading: Are there treatment options for hair loss caused by over-training?
settings.specialized__faqs_ans:
If your hair loss is caused by over-training and chronic stress put on the body (known as Telogen Effluvium) then we first would recommend that you speak to your doctor to address your concerns. They may recommend tests be done to rule out deficiencies or any other underlying health issues that could contribute to your hair loss. 

While you and your doctor work together to address any health issues, there are a few best practices related to hair care that you can implement to support your hair and hair regrowth journey:

Best hair care practices:

  • Use gentle hair care and avoid harsh ingredients such as parabens, phthalates, sulfates, and artificial fragrances.
  • Support your hair health and growth with Tru Bloom Vitamins. Our Tru Bloom Hair Vitamins have received thousands of positive reviews from real customers, many of whom have shared their hair and health journeys with us. Visit our 60-Day Challenge to see thousands of reviews and before/after photos.
  • Swap your cotton pillowcase for a satin one instead. Cotton can pull at your hair as you sleep, causing more breakage and damage to your hair. A satin pillowcase will allow your hair to move more freely and without damage. Side note: Satin pillowcases, unlike silk pillowcases, are a great vegan option.
  • Apply scalp treatments weekly. The Beach Goddess Hot Oil Hair Mask is a natural hair treatment to help deeply nourish your scalp and hair to support your best hair growth. This incredible Hot Oil Hair Mask contains proven Hair Superfoods, which can fully penetrate the human hair shaft - to repair & revitalize hair from the inside-out.
  • Reduce heat styling practices. Instead of using heat tools on your hair try to embrace your natural hair texture or use heatless hair styling methods. Heat tools can cause damage to your hair and may result in hair breakage.
